snippet: Meeting with Arab League foreign ministers, Secretary of State John Kerry said other declarations of support would come soon.
abstract: Obama administration redoubles its campaign to build support for military action against Syria, saying it has won the backing of Saudi Arabia for a strike while still laboring to persuade a deeply reluctant Congress.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER, MICHAEL R. GORDON and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, Michael R. Gordon from London, and Michael S. Schmidt from Salt Lake City. Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting from Washington, and Brian Stelter from New York.

lead_paragraph: Meeting with Arab League foreign ministers, Secretary of State John Kerry said other declarations of support would come soon.

headline.main: White House Adds Arab Support as It and Assad Use TV to Press Their Cases
headline.print_headline: White House Adds Arab Support as It and Assad Use TV to Press Their Cases
